Labels.Name: Name
Labels.DeleteItems: Are you sure you want to delete the selected {count, plural, one {item} other {items}}?
Labels.DeleteLibraryFiles:
Are you sure you want to remove the selected {count, plural, one {file} other {files}}?

Note this will not delete the {count, plural, one {file} other {files}} from disk, {count, plural, one {it} other {they}} will just be removed from the FileFlows database.
Labels.DeleteLibraryFilesPhysicallyMessage:
Are you sure you want to delete the selected {count, plural, one {file} other {files}}?

Note this will permanently delete the {count, plural, one {file} other {files}} from disk and cannot be undone.
Labels.CancelItems: Are you sure you want to cancel the selected {count, plural, one {item} other {items}}?
Labels.CancelMessage: Are you sure you want to cancel and lose any unsaved changes?
Labels.LogPartialNotAvailable: Unable to find partial log for node.
Labels.MissingDependenciesMessage:
The following missing plugins must be downloaded before using this template:

#LIST#

ObsoleteConfirm.Title: Obsolete Flow Element
ObsoleteConfirm.Message: It is recommended you switch to a different flow element.
ObsoleteConfirm.Question: This flow element is now obsolete and will soon be removed.  Are you sure you want to use this?

Import.Title: Import Flow
Import.Message: Select an exported flow to import into the system.

Messages.NoMoreImports: There are no additional imports available to this script

PauseDialog.Title: Pause Processing
PauseDialog.Message:
Select the amount of time to pause processing for.
Note: The current flows will continue to execute, but no other flows will be executed until his time is up.

ResumeDialog.Title: Resume Processing
ResumeDialog.Message: Are you sure you want to resume processing?

FlowTemplatePicker.Title: Select a template to start from

ErrorMessages.NoFlowSpecified: No flow specified, you must select a flow to create a library
ErrorMessages.CannotDeleteInternalNode: You cannot delete the internal processing node.
ErrorMessages.NotAllFilesCouldBeDeleted:
Not all the files could be deleted.
See the log for more information.

ErrorMessages.NoParts: No flow parts specific, you must have some parts to save a flow
ErrorMessages.NoInput: No input node specific, each flow needs one input node
ErrorMessages.TooManyInputNodes: You can only have one input node

Fields.Extensions-Help: A list of extensions that if match will output to the first output node, otherwise the second output node will be used.

ConvertComic.Name: Convert Comic
ConvertComic.Description: A flow that will convert a comic books from CBR, CBZ, CB7, PDF, GZ, BZ2 to either CBZ or PDF.

ConvertVideo.Name: Convert Video
ConvertVideo.Description: A flow that will convert a video file to another format.

File.Name: File
File.Description: A blank file template with a single ''Input File'' input flow element.

Folder.Name: Folder
Folder.Description:
A blank folder template with a single ''Input Folder'' input flow element.

NOTE: This template should only be used to process a Folder instead of Files.  Processing a Folder has processing limitations as the Folder is being processed and not files contained in that folder.

FailureFlow.Name: Failure Flow
FailureFlow.Description: Basic failure flow that will be executed when a flow failures for any reason.

ImageFile.Name: Image File
ImageFile.Description: A blank Image template with a single ''Image File'' input flow element.

AudioFile.Name: Audio File
AudioFile.Description: A blank Audio template with a single ''Audio File'' input flow element.

VideoFile.Name: Video File
VideoFile.Description: A blank Image template with a single ''Video File'' input flow element.

AudioBookLibrary.Name: Audio Book Library
AudioBookLibrary.Description: Audio Book library that searches for common audio book files

ComicLibrary.Name: Comic Library
ComicLibrary.Description: Comic library that searches for common comic book files

eBookLibrary.Name: eBook Library
eBookLibrary.Description: eBook library that searches for common eBook files

ImageLibrary.Name: Image Library
ImageLibrary.Description: Image library that searches for common image files

MusicLibrary.Name: Music Library
MusicLibrary.Description: Music library that searches for common music files

PlexDVR.Name: Plex DVR
PlexDVR.Description: Library to monitor Plex DVR recordings so you can automatically convert these after they have completed.

SABnzbdMusic.Name: SABnzbd Music
SABnzbdMusic.Description:
Library to monitor a "complete" downloads directory from SABnzbd.

This library can then use a flow to convert music into a target format, and place those music files in destination folder e.g. "converted".

The application that instructed SABnzbd to do the download can monitor the "converted" folder for completed files.

SABnzbdVideos.Name: SABnzbd Videos
SABnzbdVideos.Description:
Library to monitor a "complete" downloads directory from SABnzbd.

This library can then use a flow to convert videos into a target format, and place those videos in destination folder e.g. "converted".

The application that instructed SABnzbd to do the download can monitor the "converted" folder for completed files.

SamplesTrailersPreviews.Name: Samples/Trailers/Previews
SamplesTrailersPreviews.Description:
Finds any sample, trailers, or preview video files in a directory so you can delete them if necessary.
Useful for a matching 'SABnzbd Videos' library so the folder can be cleanly deleted after the main file is processed.

VideoLibrary.Name: Video Library
VideoLibrary.Description: Video library that searches for common video files

ErrorMessages.LogFailed: Failed to retrieve log for worker

Messages.CancelMessage: Are you sure you want to cancel the worker for {RelativeFile}?
Messages.Waiting: Waiting for a file to process
Messages.DeleteDashboard:
Are you sure you want to delete the current dashboard?

This cannot be undone.
Messages.DeleteWidget: Are you sure you want to remove this Widget?

Labels.SubFlowHelp:
To add input fields to a sub flow so you can pass in custom parameters to this sub flow, create these on the `Fields` tab.

A sub flow must have a single `Input` which can be any valid input flow elements, e.g. `Input File`, `Video File` etc.

Messages.Close: Are you sure you want to leave and lose all unsaved changes?

Fields.Author: Author
Fields.Author-Help: Optionally specify the author of this flow.
Fields.Outputs-Help: The number of outputs this sub flow has.  This is the number of outputs that will be available when using this sub flow in another flow

Field.Description: An optional description to be shown with this field.  This can be help text for the field.
Field.FlowElementField-Help: Optional, set this in the format '{Uid}.{FieldName}' eg ''53a72207-34a2-4b71-b3d8-8b12764a85fe.Force'' to set a field in a flow element directly.  See help for more information.
Field.Required-Help: If this value is required and must be set.
Field.Inverse-Help: If the slider values should be inversed with lower values shown on the right.
Field.DeleteIfEmpty-Help: If any values are added here and the  user selects 'Delete Original' the folder will also be deleted if no file matching any of these regular expressions match.
Field.Options-Help: An array of list options, to set a label and value use a | separator eg `label|value`
Field.IfName-Help: If this should only be shown to the user if another value matches these conditions.
Field.IfValue-Help: The value to match against, can be a regular expression.  For booleans use true or false.
Field.IfNot-Help: If the value should be inverted and should only show if the value does not match.

Fields.PageDescription: Select a template to base the flow on, this will help you get started with a flow.

Messages.DeleteUsed: You cannot delete a flow that is in use
Messages.FailureFlowDescription:
This is a special flow type that will be executed if any flow fails.
FileFlows will search for the 'Default' Failure Flow to use if a flow fails, if not found then processing will immediately stop.

Messages.DeleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the selected {count, plural, one {library} other {libraries}}?
Messages.KeepLibraryFiles: Retain files in database for statistics

Reprocess.Title: Reprocess Selected Libraries
Reprocess.Message:
Are you sure you want to proceed with reprocessing the selected libraries?

This action will mark all files as unprocessed and initiate their reprocessing. Please note that this action cannot be undone.

ErrorMessages.NoFlows:
There are no flows configured.
Create a flow before adding or updating a library.

Fields.Name: Name
Fields.Folders-Help:
If this library processes Folders instead of Files.
This does not mean to scan sub folders, a library will already do this.
This means a Folder object will be processed instead of individual files.
Fields.Priority-Help: The priority with which files should be processed. If a higher priority library has files waiting to be processed, those will be done first.
Fields.Filter-Help:
An optional filter regular expression to run against matching files.
This filter will be run against the full absolute filename of the file.
Example: \.(mp4|mkv|avi|mpg|mov)$
Fields.ExclusionFilter-Help:
An optional filter regular expression to run against matching files.
This can simplify excluding specific file names from being processed.
Fields.ExcludeHidden-Help: When enabled, hidden files and folders will not be scanned
Fields.UseFingerprinting-Help: When enabled, files will have a checksum run against them when being imported and after a flow is completed.  Any matching checksum files will be skipped from future library imports.
Fields.WaitTimeSeconds-Help: The number of seconds that have to passed since the last change was written to this folder for it to be scanned into the library.
Fields.ScanInterval-Help: The shortest possible time in seconds between scans.  It is not guaranteed to scan at this interval each time, as another scan might be in progress.
Fields.FileSizeDetectionInterval-Help: The amount of time in seconds to wait to recheck the file size during the library scanner.  Use this if another application maybe writing to a file in chunks, eg a PVR application writing parts of a recording every 20 seconds.
Fields.Schedule-Help: This schedule runs in the timezone configured under settings.
Fields.ScheduleDescription:
This allows you to configure when this library will be active.

The library scanner will not run against this library nor will any files be processed outside of the schedule.
Fields.Scan-Help:
When Scan is enabled the library will be routinely scanned for new content.
When disabled the library will listen for file system events to detect new files.
It is best to leave this off unless you are having issues with files not being detected.
Fields.UpdateMovedFiles-Help:
When enabled, if a file has been detected as moved within the same library, then the original file will be updated to point to this new file.
Otherwise when disabled, a duplicate will be added instead.

A file will be detected as moved if the original file does not exist and a new file is found with the same signature.
Fields.ReprocessRecreatedFiles-Help:
When enabled if a file is re-detected with a different creation time than that is recorded, the file will be automatically set to reprocess.
This is helpful on a library of downloaded files, where you may download the same file multiple times and wish to process it each time.
Fields.ProcessingOrder-Help: The order in which files will be processed by this library.
Fields.SkipFileAccessTests-Help: When enabled, the library will not test if it can read or write to the file before adding it to the Files queue.
Fields.HoldMinutes-Help: Optionally hold any files found in this library for this amount of minutes before processing them.  Each file will be held for this amount of time.
Fields.DetectionDescription:
Here you can configure a library to only detect files that match the given patterns.

For example, this allows you to only include files that are
	- Files that were created less than 7 days ago
	- Files that were last written to between 3 and 7 days ago
	- File size is greater than 1 gigabyte
Fields.FullScanDisabled-Help: The full scan''s intended purpose is to catch any files that may be missed by the file system watch events.
Fields.FullScanIntervalMinutes-Help: The interval when a full scan of this library should take place
Fields.DownloadsDirectory-Help:
A special directory where if a file that has been successfully processed is rediscovered in this folder, that file will automatically be reprocessed.
This is helpful if you re-download a file.
Fields.MaxRunners-Help:
The maximum runners that can process files in this library at one time.
Set to 0 for unlimited.
Fields.Extensions-Help:
An optional list of extensions for files to include in this library.
If left blank, all files will be included, unless a filter or exclusion filter is defined on the `Advanced` tab.

Labels.ScanTriggered: Scanned triggered for all enabled libraries

Messages.LockedOut: Too many incorrect login attempts, you are currently locked out.

Labels.UpgradeRequiredHint: The Server and Nodes must be on the same version

Fields.InternalProcessingNodeDescription:
This is the in-built processing node in the FileFlows.

This node allows you to run FileFlows without worrying about installing any other nodes on remote systems and lets you use FileFlows as a self contained application.

You can continue to use this internal node and additional processing nodes if you wish, or you can disable this node and only use additional nodes.
Fields.TempPath-Help: This directory will be used by flows to create temporary files as the flow is processed, this directory will be regularly cleaned up so keep nothing important here.
Fields.FlowRunners-Help: The number of flow runner instances available to execute a flow.
Fields.Address-Help: The address (hostname or IP Address) of the node.  You should not change this unless you have changed the address of the node.  For example, if you have change the computer name of the processing node.
Fields.MappingsDescription:
Mappings allow you to map a path from the server to a location on the node.

For example you may map Server:'/usr/local/bin/ffmpeg' to Node:'C:\Utils\ffmpeg\ffmpeg.exe'

You should add mappings for all libraries and tools that will be needed to run on the remote system.
Fields.VariablesDescription: Variables let you configure advanced variables to set on a processing node.
Fields.Priority-Help: The higher the number the higher the priority.  Nodes with a higher priority will be favoured and given files to process first, unless those nodes are out of schedule, disabled, at their maximum runners.
Fields.Schedule-Help: This schedule runs in the Time Zone of the node
Fields.ScheduleDescription:
This allows you to configure when this node will be active.

The node will not process any files outside of this configured schedule.
Fields.DontChangeOwner-Help:
When checked the node will change the owner of any newly created files to the PGID and PUID defined in the environmental values.
If these environmental variables are not set the owner will be changed to ''users:nobody''.
Fields.DontSetPermissions-Help: When checked file permissions will be set on any newly created files
Fields.PermissionsFiles-Help: The permissions to set on any newly created files.
Fields.PermissionsFolders-Help: The permissions to set on any newly created folders.
Fields.ProcessingDescription:
This allows you to configure what this Processing Node can process.

For example, you could limit this node to only process certain libraries or a maximum file size if this node is a lower powered node.
Fields.AllLibraries-Help: Which libraries this node will process
Fields.Libraries-Help: Select which libraries this node can process
Fields.MaxFileSizeMb-Help: The maximum file size this Processing Node can process.  If set to 0, there will be no limit.
Fields.PreExecuteScript-Help: A script that will run before any file is processed.  The result of this script must be 1 for it to pass anything else and the node will not process a file.
Fields.ProcessFileCheckInterval-Help:
How often to check for a new file to processing in the processing nodes.
Set to 0 to use the system value.

Messages.DeleteUsed: You cannot delete a plugin that is in use
Messages.DeletePlugins: Are you sure you want to delete the selected {count, plural, one {plugin} other {plugins}}?

Messages.DeleteSystem: You cannot delete a system script
Messages.DeleteUsed: You cannot delete a script that is in use
Messages.NoRepositoryScriptsToUpdate: No repository scripts selected to update

Restart.Title: Restart FileFlows
Restart.Message:
Are you sure you want to restart FileFlows?

Your settings will be automatically saved first.

Note: Ensure there are no flows executing.

DisableTelemetryConfirm.Title: Disable Telemetry
DisableTelemetryConfirm.Message:
Are you sure you want to disable telemetry?

Rest assured, no personal information is recorded. The data sent includes information about the flow elements in use, plugins utilized, as well as the total number of files failed and processed.

This information helps us understand user preferences and informs our decisions regarding the deprecation of unused flow elements.

Update.Title: Update Available
Update.Message: A new update is available, would you like to download and install it?
Update.Failed: Failed to check for an update

Fields.Telemetry-Help:
Telemetry is useful to help know what devices we need to support, what Flow parts are the most used and where we should focus on the development.
No information about your files or identify information is sent.
Fields.KeepFailedFlowTempFiles-Help:
Enabling this option will retain the temporary files used by a flow in case of failure, preventing them from being automatically deleted.
Use with caution.
Fields.AutoUpdate-Help: When enabled FileFlows will routinely be checked for updates, and if an update is found, will automatically be downloaded and installed.
Fields.AutoUpdatePlugins-Help: When enabled plugins will routinely be checked for updates, and if any updates are found will automatically be downloaded.
Fields.AutoUpdateNodes-Help: When enabled external nodes will automatically update when FileFlows server updates.  Meaning you will only have to update the FileFlows server instance in a distributed environment.
Fields.LogQueueMessages-Help:
This will cause excessive logging of all files being queued/dequeued in the library watcher.
Turn this if you are having issues with files not appearing, turn off again afterwards to avoid filling your log files with excessive logging.
Fields.LoggingPath-Help: This is where log files will be created.
Fields.LogFileRetention-Help:
How many log files to keep before deleting older log files.
Each log file is up to 10MB in size.p
Fields.LogDatabaseRetention-Help:
The maximum number of records to keep when the database log pruner executes.
Note the table is not limited to this number, as it can grow after the pruner runs, but when the pruner runs only this amount will be kept.
Fields.LogEveryRequest-Help: If every request to the server should be logged.
Fields.PluginRepositoryUrls-Help:
A line separated list of plugin repository URLs to use when searching for plugins.
The order is important, if multiple repositories contain the same plugin, the first repository will be used as it''s source.
The default repository will always be added to the end of this list.
Fields.CheckForUpdateNow-Help: Checks for an update now and if found will download the update and install it when no Flows are executing.
Fields.ShowFileAddedNotifications-Help: If a toast notification should be shown in the web console when a file has been found and added to the queue.
Fields.HideProcessingStartedNotifications-Help: If a toast notification should be shown in the web console when a file begins processing
Fields.HideProcessingFinishedNotifications-Help: If a toast notification should be shown in the web console when a file finishes processing
Fields.ProcessFileCheckInterval-Help: How often to check for a new file to processing in the processing nodes.
Fields.Language-Help: The language that will be used in the system.

Database.Description:
Here you can configure what Database FileFlows will use.
Note: Any changes here will require you to restart FileFlows so it can migrate your data and if necessary create the new database.
Database.Type-Help: The type of database to use, the default type is SQLite which requires not additional setup or configuration
Database.Server-Help: The address of the Database server and the port or named instance if required
Database.Port-Help: The default port for MySQL is 3306
Database.Port-Help-Postgres: The default port for Postgres is 5432
Database.Port-Help-MySql: The default port for MySQL is 3306
Database.Port-Help-SQLServer: The default port for SQL Server is 1433
Database.Name: Name
Database.Name-Help: The name of the database to created, if left blank ''FileFlows'' will be used
Database.User-Help: The user used to connect to the database
Database.Password-Help: The password of the user to connect to the database
Database.RecreateDatabase-Help: When enabled, if the new database already exists, it will be dropped and recreated.  Otherwise if off, and the database already exists, no data will be migrated and the new database will just be used as is.

FileServer.Description:
This allows for external processing nodes to download a file for processing without mapping.

This does expose your files over your network, so disable if not on a trusted network.
FileServer.FilePermissions-Help: Optional permissions to give to created or modified files.
FileServer.FolderPermissions-Help: Optional permissions to give to created or modified folders.
FileServer.OwnerGroup-Help: Optional owner:group to use to change the owner for created or modified files or folders
FileServer.AllowList-Placeholder: If left empty, all but system paths will be allowed.
FileServer.AllowList-Help:
A new line separated list of paths allowed to be accessed by the exposed file server.
These are the locations that can be read/written to remotely.
Note: All library paths are automatically allowed.

Smtp.Security-Help: The security to use when sending emails
Smtp.User-Help: An optional username to send emails from
Smtp.Password-Help: The password for the SMTP user
Smtp.From-Help: The name of the user who emails will be sent from
Smtp.FromAddress-Help: The email address of the user who emails will be sent from

Security.Title: Security
Security.Mode-Help:
Enable user authentication to access FileFlows.
When enabled users will have to login in and processing nodes will require the API Token to access the server.
Security.AccessToken-Help: Access Token used by processing nodes to connect to the server
Security.TokenExpiryMinutes-Help: The duration of the login token before it expires.
Security.Description:
Configuring user security will require users to login and processing nodes to provide the Access Token to connect.

[Users](/users) must be added before they can sign in or before you can use this feature.
Security.Authority-Help: Enter the URL of the Open ID Connect provider (e.g., https://accounts.google.com/).
Security.ClientId-Help: The client ID registered with the Open ID Connect provider.
Security.ClientSecret-Help: The client secret registered with the Open ID Connect provider.
Security.CallbackAddress-Help:
An optional callback address, you can use this to override the default address this will send to the client.
 For example if you are behind a reverse proxy and FileFLows is listening on HTTP but the callback should occur on HTTPS.
Security.MaxAttempts-Help: The maximum number of login attempts the user is allowed before they are temporarily blocked
Security.LockoutMinutes-Help: The duration the user will be locked out for before they can reattempt a login.

Messages.NoScripts: No scripts found to create a task for.
Messages.NoHistory: This task has no run history available.

Messages.EmailInUse: Email address ''{email}'' is already in use by another user ''{user}''.

Messages.InvalidIPAddress: '{address}' is not a valid IP address.
Messages.FamilyMismatch: The start and end IP addresses must be the same type
Messages.EndMustBeGreaterThan: The end address must be greater than the start address

Fields.Description-Placeholder: An optional description to describe this entry
Fields.Start-Help: The start IP Address can be either IPv4 or IPv6
Fields.End-Help: Optional end IP Address, must be greater than the start address if set and of the same type. Otherwise this end value will be ignored.
Fields.Allow-Help: If this access control entry is allowed to access the system or not.

Fields.Script-Help: The script to execute at the configured schedule
Fields.CustomSchedule-Help: This task will run once per 15 minute block at the start of that block
Fields.Type-Help: The type of task this.  Time based tasks will run at the configured times.  Other tasks are event based
Fields.TimeSchedule-Help: When the task will be run
